definition: (written) in black and white
surname Bai

white/snowy/pure/bright/empty/blank/plain/clear/to make clear/in vain/gratuitous/free of charge/reactionary/anti-communist/funeral/to stare coldly/to write wrong character/to state/to explain/vernacular/spoken lines in opera
paper/CL:張|张[zhang1],沓[da2]/classifier for documents, letter etc
abbr. for Heilongjiang province 黑龍江|黑龙江[Hei1 long2 jiang1]
black/dark/sinister/secret/shady/illegal/to hide (sth) away/to vilify/(loanword) to hack (computing)
letter/symbol/character/word/CL:個|个[ge4]/courtesy or style name traditionally given to males aged 20 in dynastic China

sentences.english: We'd better put everything in black and white.
sentences.chinese: 我們最好把一切都白紙黑字寫下來。

sentences.english: These terms are clearly written in black and white. You can never deny them.
sentences.chinese: 這些條件白紙黑字，一清二楚，想抵賴是抵賴不掉的。

sentences.english: There, on page 2, in black and white, was the bad news.
sentences.chinese: 就在那兒，第二頁，白紙黑字，寫的是個壞消息。

sentences.english: I'll put everything black and white !
sentences.chinese: 我會把所有事情白紙黑字寫清楚。

sentences.english: I'll put everything in black and white!
sentences.chinese: 我會把所有事變白紙黑字寫清楚。

sentences.english: eg：1)They demanded that the agreement be written in black and white.
sentences.chinese: 他們要求將這份協議用白紙黑字寫下來。

sentences.english: They demanded that the agreement be written in black and white.
sentences.chinese: 他們要求將這份協議用白紙黑字寫下來。

sentences.english: He insisted on putting the agreement down in black and white .
sentences.chinese: 他堅持要把這項協議用白紙黑字寫下來。

sentences.english: Other laws, black on white, obtain.
sentences.chinese: 另有法令，白紙黑字，統領此地。

sentences.english: Take a look at your budget in black and white.
sentences.chinese: 用白紙黑字寫出您的預算計劃。

sentences.english: They just put it in black and white terms.
What you said is down here in black and white .
sentences.chinese: 你說的話已成爲白紙黑字，記在這裏呢？

sentences.english: Virtually no one suggested in print that unification had been a bad thing.
sentences.chinese: 實際上沒有人白紙黑字地表明，統一是一件壞事。

sentences.english: It clearly stated that the state of California would not be able to recognize any marriage unions between same-sex parties.
sentences.chinese: 它白紙黑字地規定加州不再承認任何同性結合爲婚姻。

sentences.english: Now, you may not think that implied consent is as good as the real thing.
sentences.chinese: 不過你可能認爲默認的同意不如白紙黑字的協議。

sentences.english: He insisted on putting the agreement down in black and white.
sentences.chinese: 他堅持要把這項協議用白紙黑字寫下來。

definition: to play deaf-mute
to avoid the important and dwell on the trivial/to keep silent about major charges while admitting minor ones
to sensationalize (idiom); deliberate exaggeration to scare people
to ask for trouble/to invite difficulties
misconception/fallacy
frightening words to scare people (idiom); alarmist talk/reds under the beds
lit. wind from an empty cave (idiom)/fig. unfounded (story)/baseless (claim)
outward devotion but inner opposition (idiom); to pay lip service/to agree overtly, but oppose in secret
to work to no avail (idiom)
important matter that must be kept secret (idiom); don't breathe a word of it to anyone!
to make a story or theory consistent/to give a plausible explanation/to plug the holes in one's story
to confuse one thing with another (idiom); to muddle
evidence
two-China (policy)

unilateral/one-sided/home remedy/folk prescription(same as 丹方)/single-drug prescription (same as 奇方[ji1 fang1], one of the seven kinds of prescriptions of Chinese medicine 七方[qi1 fang1])/metaphorically. a good solution
questionnaire/inventory list/CL:張|张[zhang1],份[fen4]
